programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Dave threatens to dampen high spirits at an early morning auction, and Mary struggles to stop the other buyers from getting her down.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys snap to attention when a client brings in a rare West Point musket. They also get offered pilot licences signed by father of flight Orville Wright.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Items appraised include an antique electrotherapy kit, a 19th-century revolving cannon, a jukebox from 1973 and a 50-year-old electric waffle iron.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick is challenged to convert a 1960s Volkswagen Beetle into a child's bed.

programme.title: American Restoration
programme.desc: Rick tries to restore a 1920s Haunted House car with the help of Ted and new painter Niko. The vehicle was damaged during Hurricane Sandy.

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Members of the Coquihalla Highway rescue crew face their toughest recovery as they are forced to pull a damaged truck up a sheer 400-metre cliff.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Chris and Robbie's latest assignment is threatened by a bride-to-be, while Jarrett and Chris get separated during a job.

programme.title: Shipping Wars
programme.desc: Johnny's day is ruined when Marc plays a prank on him, and Jennifer transports a cold and creepy shipment.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: How a tiny clue led investigators to the seemingly unlikely man behind the murder of a 22-year-old woman, who was found stabbed 46 times in Germantown, Philadelphia, in 1999.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: A member of staff races to find a woman's impounded car while her taxi waits outside, and an experienced parking warden shows off her ticket dispensing instincts.

programme.title: Parking Wars
programme.desc: Series following the work of employees at the Philadelphia Parking Authority, who carry out the often unpleasant job of handing out fines and impounding vehicles.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites comedian Jimmy Carr, writer Steven Moffat and singer Rochelle Humes to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include sandy beaches, other people's opinions and being Scottish.

programme.title: Room 101
programme.desc: Frank Skinner invites Line of Duty star Vicky McClure, comedian and writer Sandi Toksvig and comedian and presenter Josh Widdicombe to express their anger over individuals, events and objects that upset them, hoping to curry the host's favour and see them consigned to oblivion. Their gripes include real ale, hotel leaflets and coat hangers.

programme.title: Insert Name Here
programme.desc: Sue Perkins hosts a festive edition of the game show, which sees Jack Dee, Martin Kemp, Liz Bonnin and Suzannah Lipscomb joining team captains Josh Widdicombe and Richard Osman. As it's a Christmas special, however, there is a twist to the usual format - all the names are different, but every one of them is somehow related to Christmas.

programme.title: Live at the Apollo
programme.sub-title: Live at the Apollo Christmas Special
programme.desc: The BAFTA nominated comedy showcase returns for it's third annual Christmas special, welcoming some of the biggest and best comedic talent to the stage for some Yuletide frolics. Previous editions have featured stand-up routines and compering from renowned comedians such as Ed Byrne, Nish Kumar, Rob Beckett, Sara Pascoe and Henning Wehn. This time, Canadian comedian, writer and actress Katherine Ryan hosts the show, welcoming former I'm A Celebrity contestant and stand-up comic Joel Dommett, and Bristol-born comedian and radio presenter John Robins to the stage.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon's first night shift coincides with Halloween and an escaped prisoner roaming the wards - will he and Frankie survive?.

programme.title: Porters
programme.desc: Simon breaks the hospital's new multi-million-pound surgical robot and has to fix it before a YouTube star goes under the knife.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. The team is baffled by the conflicting possible motives after two women are shot dead in a house basement - and the investigation isn't helped by Jack having to work alongside an old flame, the ambitious DI Chrissy Reed. Meanwhile, Leo faces a difficult choice when he is asked to prove his pathologist mentor made a mistake in a case that resulted in a mother being imprisoned for smothering her baby to death. Emilia Fox, William Gaminara and David Caves star.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters launch their spring collection for working women to much acclaim, which leads to Beatrice and Evie receiving an offer that has both business and personal consequences. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters return to London following the success of their designs for American store Sears, only to find that business back home has suffered in their absence.

programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: How to Spend It Well at Christmas with Phillip Schofield
programme.desc: The presenter introduces a guide to this year's must-have toys, and Leicester City striker Jamie Vardy and his wife Rebekah join five families in trying out the latest board games. Phillip competes against racing driver Billy Monger in a remote control car road test, Stacey Solomon checks out fancy dress costumes for children, and children recommend presents under Â£15.

programme.title: On Assignment
programme.desc: Rageh Omaar presents reports from around the world. Paul Davies returns to Bucharest 30 years after reporting on the Romanian revolution, John Irvine reports on an unusual solution to a lack of available burial space in Jerusalem - a six-storey underground cemetery, and Penny Marshall visits safe houses and drug rehab centres run by a British Christian missionary in South Africa.

programme.title: The Jonathan Ross Show
programme.desc: The host is joined by guests tennis champion Andy Murray, Luke Evans, recently seen in Second World War drama Midway, doctor-turned-comic and author of bestseller This is Going to Hurt Adam Kay, and comedian Desiree Burch.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Under The Mistletoe! Xmas Love Songs
programme.desc: We're here to spread the love this Xmas with 10 of the best christmas love songs.

programme.title: That Christmas Feeling
programme.desc: Once again the famous Magic Christmas provides the soundtrack to your seasonal celebrations. We'll be playing all your festive favourites until you've finished your final turkey sandwich.

programme.title: The Fresh List
programme.desc: Keep up to date with some of the hottest new videos dropping right now, from some of your favourite artists and introducing some brand new artists.

programme.title: Super Hits & New Releases!
programme.desc: Tune in to these super-hot hits and the latest trending videos. Look no further for today's music fix.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: How Do They Do It?
programme.desc: The way billions of bees help produce tons of California almonds, how snow is cleared to keep planes functional in Norway, and the removal of tricky stains.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Mike Brewer tries to double his money by working with expert mechanic Edd China to turn an Austin-Healey Frogeye Sprite into a quality classic car. Once completed, the duo test-drive it around the Brooklands Motor Museum in Surrey, prior to selling it on at a profit.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells two cars at Mecum Auctions and cannot resist bidding for vintage jeeps and a Chevy pickup.

programme.title: Chasing Classic Cars
programme.desc: Wayne Carini sells classic Italian sports cars, including a 1971 Ferrari Daytona Spyder, at an auction.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Unravelling Underwater, Skydive Scramble, Russian Rumble
programme.desc: More footage hair-raising disaster footage, including a dizzying perspective on a skydiving accident.

programme.title: Chaos Caught on Camera
programme.sub-title: Extreme Explosion, Frightening Fireworks, Jittery Jump
programme.desc: Amazing tales of human endurance and survival to calamitous engineering failures - all caught on camera.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: Dozens of barrels containing volatile chemicals explode, and the test flight of a military jet ends in a crash on the runway. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A massive explosion hits an oil storage depot, and in Canada a bull ends a rodeo rider's career. Presented by Ron Pitts.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: Bobby Goodson and his crew hope moving to a new area will improve their logging efforts, but the swamp almost swallows Justin and his machine.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: Chip Foose and the team head to Las Vegas to overhaul a Chrysler 300, which they then plan to give away to a SEMA Convention attendee.
